results.adx_keywords: your-feed-visual-investigations;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Defense and Military Forces;War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
results.byline: By Yousur Al-Hlou, Masha Froliak, Evan Hill, Malachy Browne and David Botti
results.title: New Evidence Shows How Russian Soldiers Executed Men in Bucha
results.abstract: Witness testimony and videos obtained by The New York Times show how Russian paratroopers executed at least eight Ukrainian men in a Kyiv suburb on March 4, a potential war crime.
des_facet: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

results.adx_keywords: Reading and Writing Skills (Education);Illiteracy;Dyslexia;Education (K-12);Teachers and School Employees;Content Type: Personal Profile;Calkins, Lucy;Teachers College of Columbia University
results.title: In the Fight Over How to Teach Reading, This Guru Makes a Major Retreat
results.abstract: Lucy Calkins, a leading literacy expert, has rewritten her curriculum to include a fuller embrace of phonics and the science of reading. Critics may not be appeased.

media.caption: Lucy Calkins, an education professor, created a popular curriculum called “Units of Study,” built on a vision of children as natural readers and writers.
media.copyright: Evelyn Freja for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Uvalde, Tex, Shooting (May 24, 2022);Teachers and School Employees;Robb Elementary School (Uvalde, Tex);Uvalde (Tex)
results.title: The husband of a teacher killed in the massacre has died of a heart attack.
results.abstract: The couple had been married for 24 years and had four children, with the oldest 23 and the others teenagers.

media.caption: Joe Garcia and his wife, Irma Garcia. Mr. Garcia died of a heart attack two days after his wife was killed in the shooting at Robb Elementary School in Uvalde.

results.adx_keywords: Language and Languages;English Language
results.byline: By Josh Katz and Wilson Andrews
results.title: How Y’all, Youse and You Guys Talk
results.abstract: What does the way you speak say about where you’re from? Answer all the questions below to see your personal dialect map.

results.adx_keywords: Food Contamination and Poisoning;Salmonella (Bacteria);Peanut Butter;Recalls and Bans of Products;Food and Drug Administration;JM Smucker Company
results.title: Several Jif Peanut Butter Products Recalled Over Potential Salmonella
results.abstract: The J.M. Smucker Company said it initiated a voluntary recall and advised consumers to dispose of some potentially contaminated products.

media.caption: The Jif products voluntarily recalled include several types of creamy, crunchy, reduced-fat and natural peanut butter in various sizes.
media.copyright: Paul Hennessy/SOPA Images, via AP Images

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Subways;Adams, Eric L;Enriquez, Daniel (d 2022);Manhattan (NYC);New York City
results.byline: By Ashley Southall and Nate Schweber
results.title: Man Fatally Shot on Manhattan Subway in Unprovoked Attack
results.abstract: A gunman shot and killed Daniel Enriquez, 48, on a Q train in Lower Manhattan on Sunday. “It’s horrific, this is a horror movie,” his sister said.

media.caption: Daniel Enriquez, 48, was shot in the chest by a gunman while riding a Q train on Sunday.

results.adx_keywords: Colleges and Universities;Freedom of Speech and Expression;Race and Ethnicity;George Floyd Protests (2020);Katz, Joshua T (1969- );Eisgruber, Christopher L;Princeton University
results.title: After Campus Uproar, Princeton Proposes to Fire Tenured Professor
results.abstract: Joshua Katz says he was targeted because of his criticism of a campus protest group. A university report says the concerns are related to his inappropriate conduct with a female student.

media.caption: The controversy around Joshua Katz, a classics professor, has divided the Princeton campus. He has become a cause célèbre among conservative columnists.

results.adx_keywords: Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Presidential Election of 2020;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;Pence, Mike;Meadows, Mark R (1959- )
results.byline: By Maggie Haberman and Luke Broadwater
results.title: Trump Said to Have Reacted Approvingly to Jan. 6 Chants About Hanging Pence
results.abstract: The House committee investigating the Capitol assault has heard accounts of the former president’s remarks as he watched the riot unfold on television.

media.caption: Vice President Mike Pence resisted pressure to block or delay certification of the Electoral College results of Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s victory in the 2020 election.
media.copyright: Jacob Langston for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Movies;Television;Actors and Actresses;Liotta, Ray
results.title: Ray Liotta, of ‘Goodfellas’ and ‘Field of Dreams,’ Dies at 67
results.abstract: He was known for his intensity, especially in crime dramas, but he was also adept at comedy. “You want to do as many different genres as you can,” he once said.

media.caption: Ray Liotta in the 2005 film "Revolver," directed by Guy Ritchie.

results.adx_keywords: Long Covid;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Research;Centers for Disease Control and Prevention;United States
results.title: More than 1 in 5 adult Covid survivors in the U.S. may develop long Covid, a C.D.C. study suggests.
results.abstract: Researchers identified lasting health problems in many different organ systems, including the heart, lungs and kidneys.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: John Gillotte of New York City was infected with Covid in March 2020. After being hospitalized and on a ventilator for five days, he then experienced long Covid symptoms that lasted for months.
media.copyright: Joshua Bright for The New York Times

results.title: ‘S.N.L.’ Says Goodbye to Multiple Cast Members
results.abstract: Kate McKinnon, Pete Davidson and Aidy Bryant each got to take a victory lap in a “Saturday Night Live” season finale hosted by Natasha Lyonne.

results.adx_keywords: News and News Media;Television;Right-Wing Extremism and Alt-Right;Conspiracy Theories;Content Type: Personal Profile;Logan, Lara;CBS News;Fox Nation
results.title: Lara Logan, Once a Star at CBS News, Is Now One for the Far Right
results.abstract: The former chief foreign affairs correspondent is now a popular guest on podcasts hosted by vaccine skeptics and deniers of the 2020 election.

media.caption: Lara Logan in 2016. Some of her former CBS News colleagues recalled that when they worked together, her politics were not always easy to categorize.

results.adx_keywords: Slavery (Historical);Colonization;Coffee;Economic Conditions and Trends;Poverty;Politics and Government;Reparations;International Relations;Haiti;France
results.byline: By Catherine Porter, Constant Méheut, Matt Apuzzo and Selam Gebrekidan
results.title: The Root of Haiti’s Misery: Reparations to Enslavers
results.abstract: In 1791, enslaved Haitians ousted the French and founded a nation. But France made generations of Haitians pay for their freedom. How much it cost them was a mystery, until now.

media.caption: An illustration depicting plantations burning in 1791, during the Haitian Revolution.
media.copyright: Universal Images Group, via Getty Images

results.title: Amber Heard and the Death of #MeToo
results.abstract: The actress is being subjected to industrial-scale bullying.

results.title: Why We Love to Watch a Woman Brought Low
results.abstract: Whatever you think of the actress Amber Heard, what we are watching is a good old-fashioned public pillorying; the only difference is that memes have replaced the stones.

results.adx_keywords: Organized Crime;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Forensic Science;Reservoirs;Global Warming;Drought;Las Vegas (Nev);Lake Mead
results.title: Bodies Pulled From Parched Lake Mead Stir Wise-Guy Ghosts of Las Vegas
results.abstract: As climate change fuels grim discoveries across the West, Las Vegas is awash in bets on the identity of a suspected murder victim dumped in a barrel.

media.caption: Dropping water levels in Lake Mead, above the Hoover Dam, revealed human remains that have probably been hidden for decades.
media.copyright: Joe Buglewicz for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Colleges and Universities;Freedom of Speech and Expression;Academic Freedom;Ethics and Official Misconduct;Katz, Joshua T (1969- );Princeton University
results.title: Princeton Fires Tenured Professor in Campus Controversy
results.abstract: Joshua Katz’s dismissal is related to his inappropriate conduct with a female student, the university said. He says criticism of a campus protest group is the issue.

media.caption: Joshua Katz, a classics professor, had been suspended in 2018 for a consensual sexual relationship with a student. But the university now says he was not fully honest and cooperative with that investigation.

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);United States International Relations;Defense and Military Forces;Donbas (Ukraine);Russia
results.byline: By Andrew E. Kramer, Maria Varenikova and Ivor Prickett
results.title: Powerful American Artillery Enters the Fight in Ukraine
results.abstract: The most lethal weapons the West has provided so far to Ukraine are now deployed in combat. Will they make a critical difference for Ukraine’s military in a war that has mostly become an artillery battle?

media.caption: A gun crew of the 55th Separate Artillery Brigade of Ukraine’s Armed Forces, fired a Howitzer M777 155mm artillery piece towards Russian positions in the Donetsk region of Ukraine.
media.copyright: Ivor Prickett for The New York Times
